document.masterDocTitle: New species and new records of predaceous midges in the genera, Schizonyxhelea Clastrier and Stilobezzia Kieffer from Mexico (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and new records of predaceous midges in the genera, Schizonyxhelea Clastrier and Stilobezzia Kieffer from Mexico (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Schizonyxhelea thomsenae :
Borkent 2014 : 66
(combination; in review of pupae of Ceratopogonidae );
Borkent 2016 : 134
(in online World catalog).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion. This primarily Neotropical species is known from the USA ( Florida ), Mexico ( Yucatan ), Panama , in the Caribbean region from Jamaica , and it was recently recorded from Guadeloupe (
Grogan et al . 2013
).
It can be very abundant in Malaise and CDC light trap
collections (Huerta, Grogan, personal observations). Huerta (2002) reported more than 200 individuals associated with predominantly forested ecosystems in Yucatan , Mexico
.
We provide the first record of
S . thomsenae
from Guatemala and new records from Mexico in the states of Guerrero , Jalisco , Tabasco and Veracruz
.
